intro: Ctenium concinnum, commonly known as the slender ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Ctenium concinnum is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
